definitions: relating to or based on the theory of probability rather than certainty
characterized by random variables and statistical likelihood in predicting outcomes
examples: Weather forecasting uses probabilistic models to predict rain
The scientist developed a probabilistic approach to disease spread
Quantum mechanics describes a probabilistic universe at the atomic level
Their probabilistic algorithm improved search results significantly

definitions: likely to occur or be true based on available evidence
appearing reasonable or believable given the circumstances and facts
examples: Rain is probable tomorrow according to the forecast
The probable cause of the accident was speeding
His explanation seemed probable given all the evidence
The detective identified several probable suspects

definitions: relating to a period of testing or trial before permanent acceptance
examples: New employees work through a probationary period
The student was on probationary status after failing grades
The probationary officer monitored his progress closely
She completed her probationary training successfully

definitions: searching persistently and thoroughly into something to discover information
involving physical examination or investigation with instruments or tools
examples: The journalist asked probing questions about the scandal
Her probing analysis revealed hidden patterns in the data
The doctor used probing instruments during the examination
Scientists sent probing devices deep into the ocean

definitions: presenting a problem or difficulty that needs to be resolved
doubtful or questionable in nature and requiring further examination
examples: The new policy proved problematic for small businesses
His problematic behavior disrupted the entire classroom
The study's methodology was problematic according to critics
Their problematic assumptions led to incorrect conclusions

definitions: relating to an established or official way of doing something
examples: The lawyer raised several procedural objections
They followed all procedural requirements for the application
The procedural manual explained each step clearly
Television networks love procedural crime dramas

definitions: subjected to a special treatment or series of actions to prepare
analyzed or dealt with mentally or emotionally over time
examples: The processed cheese melts more easily than natural cheese
All applications must be processed within thirty days
She hasn't fully processed the trauma from the accident
The computer processed millions of calculations per second

definitions: relating to or used in formal processions or ceremonial parades
examples: The processional music played as graduates entered
They walked in processional order down the aisle
The church displayed beautiful processional banners
A processional cross led the religious ceremony

definitions: announced officially or publicly with formal declaration or authority
declared oneself to be something without external verification
examples: The proclaimed winner gave an acceptance speech
The governor proclaimed a state of emergency
The self-proclaimed expert offered questionable advice
He was a proclaimed vegetarian who secretly ate meat

definitions: spending money or resources freely and recklessly in a wasteful way
returning after a long absence like the biblical prodigal son
examples: His prodigal spending habits emptied his bank account
The government's prodigal use of resources sparked criticism
The prodigal daughter returned home after years abroad
Like a prodigal child, he sought forgiveness from family

definitions: remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree
so great as to cause amazement or wonder in observers
examples: She demonstrated prodigious talent at the piano
The storm brought prodigious amounts of rainfall
His prodigious memory allowed him to recall every detail
The team showed prodigious improvement this season

definitions: showing disrespect or contempt for sacred or religious things
relating to ordinary life rather than religious or spiritual matters
examples: His profane language shocked the congregation
The vandals left profane graffiti on the church walls
The museum displayed both sacred and profane art
She studied the profane literature of medieval times

definitions: openly declared or acknowledged as one's belief or position
claimed or pretended often falsely or without genuine conviction
examples: His professed love for classical music was genuine
The professed goals of the organization seemed noble
Despite his professed expertise, he knew very little
Her professed innocence didn't convince the jury

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a professor in manner or appearance
examples: He adopted a professorial tone when explaining the concept
Her professorial appearance included glasses and tweed jacket
The speaker's professorial manner put students at ease
His professorial beard gave him an academic look

definitions: competent or skilled in doing something through practice and familiarity
examples: She became proficient in Spanish after living abroad
The job requires someone proficient in computer programming
Only proficient swimmers should attempt this challenging course
Years of practice made him proficient at public speaking

definitions: producing a financial profit or gain from business operations
resulting in advantage or benefit beyond just monetary gain
examples: The company had its most profitable year ever
Small businesses struggle to remain profitable
The training proved profitable for career advancement
It was a profitable use of everyone's time

definitions: abundant, plentiful, or given freely in large amounts
examples: The garden produced profuse blooms all summer long
She offered profuse apologies for the misunderstanding
Profuse sweating can indicate serious health issues
The author received profuse praise for her novel

definitions: relating to or serving as a prediction of future outcomes, especially medical
examples: The prognostic indicators suggested a good recovery
Doctors use prognostic factors to plan treatment
The prognostic value of the test was questioned
Several prognostic signs pointed to economic downturn

definitions: formally forbidden by law, rule, or authority from being done
examples: Smoking is prohibited in all public buildings
The prohibited items were confiscated at security
Photography was prohibited inside the museum
Several prohibited substances were found in his possession

definitions: serving to forbid, restrict, or prevent something from happening
so high in cost as to prevent purchase or use
examples: The government imposed prohibitive tariffs on imports
Prohibitive regulations stifled small business growth
The prohibitive cost of housing forced them to relocate
Tuition fees have become prohibitive for many families

definitions: estimated or forecast to occur in the future based on current data
displayed or cast onto a surface using light or other means
examples: The projected costs exceeded the initial budget
Projected enrollment numbers influenced hiring decisions
The projected image appeared clearly on the screen
Maps were projected onto the conference room wall

definitions: relating to an object thrown or shot forward through the air
examples: The projectile motion followed a parabolic path
Police found projectile weapons at the scene
Students studied projectile physics in science class
The projectile velocity was measured precisely

definitions: extending outward from a surface or beyond a boundary line
estimating or predicting something in the future based on present trends
examples: The projecting balcony offered a scenic view
Be careful of projecting nails on the old fence
The analyst was projecting sales for next quarter
Stop projecting your fears onto other people

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the industrial working class
examples: The proletarian movement gained political momentum
His proletarian background influenced his worldview
The novel depicted proletarian life in factories
They embraced proletarian values of hard work

definitions: producing much fruit, foliage, or many offspring; highly productive
examples: The prolific author published three books yearly
Rabbits are prolific breeders in ideal conditions
Mozart was a prolific composer throughout his life
The prolific plant produced tomatoes all season

definitions: continuing for a long time or longer than usual or expected
examples: The prolonged drought devastated local agriculture
She suffered from prolonged exposure to toxic chemicals
After prolonged negotiations, they reached an agreement
The prolonged applause lasted several minutes

definitions: having many casual sexual partners without commitment or discrimination
showing lack of discrimination or careful choice in general matters
examples: His promiscuous lifestyle worried his family
The promiscuous behavior spread disease rapidly
The promiscuous use of antibiotics created resistance
Their promiscuous spending habits led to bankruptcy

definitions: containing or conveying a promise or assurance of future action
examples: He signed a promissory note for the loan
The promissory agreement bound both parties legally
Her promissory statements reassured the investors
The contract included several promissory clauses

definitions: relating to the publicizing of a product, organization, or venture
examples: The promotional campaign increased brand awareness significantly
She received promotional materials in the mail
The store offered promotional discounts all weekend
His promotional efforts boosted ticket sales considerably

definitions: promoted or made widely known officially through formal declaration
examples: The newly promulgated laws took effect immediately
The promulgated decree changed taxation policies
Religious leaders promulgated their teachings widely
The promulgated standards improved industry practices

definitions: having a tendency or likelihood to suffer from or do something
lying flat with the face and front of body downward
examples: She's prone to headaches during stressful periods
The area is prone to flooding in spring
The patient lay prone on the examination table
Soldiers crawled prone through the training course

definitions: relating to ancient Greece or the ancient Greeks and their culture
examples: The museum displayed beautiful Hellenic sculptures
Hellenic philosophy influenced Western thought profoundly
Students studied Hellenic literature in classical programs
The Hellenic period produced remarkable architectural achievements

definitions: relating to Greek culture after Alexander the Great spread it widely
examples: Hellenistic art blended Greek and Eastern styles
The Hellenistic period lasted three centuries
Alexandria became a major Hellenistic cultural center
Hellenistic science made significant mathematical advances

definitions: relating to the Himalaya mountain range in Asia
examples: The Himalayan peaks attract climbers from worldwide
Himalayan salt has become popular in cooking
They studied Himalayan wildlife at high altitudes
The Himalayan region faces environmental challenges

definitions: relating to the Hindi language spoken primarily in India
examples: She enrolled in Hindi language classes
The Hindi film industry produces hundreds of movies
Hindi literature has a rich historical tradition
They needed a Hindi translator for the documents

definitions: relating to Hinduism or its practitioners and cultural traditions
examples: The Hindu temple welcomed visitors during festivals
Hindu philosophy encompasses diverse spiritual traditions
They celebrated Hindu holidays with traditional rituals
The Hindu community organized charitable events

definitions: relating to the Hindi-Urdu language or north Indian cultural traditions
examples: Hindustani classical music has two main traditions
She studied Hindustani vocal techniques for years
The Hindustani language evolved over many centuries
Hindustani cuisine features rich, aromatic spices

definitions: relating to Hippocrates or the ethical principles of medical practice
examples: Doctors still take the Hippocratic oath today
The Hippocratic principle emphasizes doing no harm
Hippocratic medicine revolutionized ancient healing practices
She followed Hippocratic teachings in patient care

definitions: relating to the ancient Hittite empire and people of Anatolia
examples: Hittite cuneiform tablets revealed ancient laws
The Hittite empire rivaled Egypt in power
Archaeologists discovered Hittite artifacts in Turkey
Hittite metalworking techniques were highly advanced

definitions: relating to the Hmong ethnic group from Southeast Asia
examples: The Hmong community celebrated their new year
Hmong embroidery displays intricate traditional patterns
She learned about Hmong history and culture
Hmong refugees settled in many Western countries

definitions: relating to the American film industry centered in Hollywood, California
examples: The Hollywood studio system dominated global cinema
She dreamed of Hollywood stardom since childhood
Hollywood movies influenced popular culture worldwide
The Hollywood sign became an iconic landmark

definitions: relating to Homer's epics or resembling their grand heroic style
examples: The team's Homeric struggle ended in victory
His Homeric laughter filled the entire room
Students analyzed Homeric epithets in the Iliad
The film depicted battles of Homeric scale

definitions: relating to Honduras or its people, culture, and customs
examples: Honduran coffee ranks among the world's finest
The Honduran embassy hosted a cultural event
She studied Honduran archaeological sites extensively
Honduran immigrants brought rich traditions with them

definitions: relating to Hungary or its people, language, and culture
examples: Hungarian goulash became popular internationally
She studied Hungarian history at the university
The Hungarian parliament building dominates Budapest's skyline
Hungarian folk dances require incredible skill

definitions: having a specified number of projecting pointed parts or tines
examples: The three-pronged fork was perfect for salads
They launched a multi-pronged attack strategy
A two-pronged approach solved the complex problem
The pronged tool helped remove stubborn weeds

definitions: very noticeable or marked in degree or quality
formally or officially declared, especially by authority
examples: She spoke with a pronounced accent
The patient showed pronounced improvement
The judge pronounced them legally married
The doctor pronounced him dead at the scene

definitions: relating to or characteristic of propaganda or those who spread it
examples: The propagandist message distorted the truth
His propagandist writings supported the regime
They rejected the propagandist nature of the film
The propagandist campaign influenced public opinion

definitions: having the nature or characteristics of propaganda in style or intent
examples: The propagandistic posters covered city walls
Critics called the documentary propagandistic
Her propagandistic speech lacked balanced perspective
The propagandistic content manipulated viewer emotions

definitions: serving to propel or drive forward, especially as fuel
examples: The rocket used liquid propellant fuel
Aerosol cans contain propellant gases
Scientists developed more efficient propellant mixtures
The propellant charge launched the projectile

definitions: driving or pushing something forward with force
examples: The propelling force sent the boat forward
Wind was propelling the sailboat across the lake
The propelling mechanism needed regular maintenance
Ambition was the propelling factor in her success
